title: UBIT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the resume, there was an email requesting to schedule a 30 min inperson interview. There were 3 interviewers, They started asking some behavioural questions then transitioned into some technical ones
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. How would you react if a customer came to you and said that their laptop was not working?

title: Dietetic Intertnship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: The interview went smoothly. The program director will schedule an online interview with you. In the beginning, the director will explain the program to you then they will ask some questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nutrition as your major?

title: Student Success Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: The interview was only 30 minutes, but the committee was upbeat and kind. They asked very good questions, and gave me the opportunity to speak my own mind in regard to the position.
Interview Questions: Please tell us an experience you had with a student of a diverse background.

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Multi-step interview process where a presentation in front of the staff was required. The onsite interview included was with three groups: the hiring committee, staff, and supervisor with the director. The process was long, but they did great to respect previous commitments to the previous role and future commitments to outside pursuits.
Interview Questions: What makes diversity important to you?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable and conversational. I am literally only posting this because I have to in order to use this website and this was a work study position from over a decade ago.
Interview Questions: What my class schedule was

title: Assistant Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview. They asked me a series of questions. I waited a long time before hearing back. I interviewed with the administrators and some of the lower level professional staff.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience

title: Library Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initially applied for the job position using online forum. Recieved an interview invitation schedule within a week. The interview took about 30 minutes. I was given a scenario based question regarding work place, specifically library setting.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me a bit about yourself. 2. Tell us about a time when you had to work independently with minimal supervision and how you did do completing the task assigned to you? 3. Describe a specific time where you took the initiative to act rather than waiting to be told what to do in a work environment.

title: Apprentice Electrician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Exam with basic hr questions, takes 1-2 hours. Callback is fairly quick too. No drug test. Flexible hours. The interview has Atleast 8 people involved. UB is a great place to work and they are always hiring. They do a background check that is a bit annoying as it’s a third party company
Interview Questions: A time you failed and how to you resolve it

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple and straight forward. I applied online, and someone reached out to me within two weeks time. First round was a phone interview, second was in person at the facilities. It was for an animal care technician position, the women (and entire staff) who run the department are absolutely wonderful and caring people!
Interview Questions: Experience with animal animal husbandry, to give some examples. How I felt about working with animals in the research department.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: 20 minutes interview process, asking general questions about yourself and any prior experience and behavioral questions related to the job roles. after that, they informed me about the results the next day.
Interview Questions: do you have any prior experience in teaching?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: One round which was mix of technical and behavioral. They test you on how you behave and take strategic action on different scenarios such as dealing  unstructured data. Also they will test your knowledge on SQL and visualization skills.
Interview Questions: Have you previously worked on multicultural team?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Graduate application was organized and thorough. It is easier if you have already completed your undergrad there. It is also helpful to have recommendation letters from professors or other figures.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to continue your degree in graduate level?

title: Clinical Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY)
Interview Descriptions: all atmosphere was really professional and every person in the committee knows how to react and how to approach in questions and communications. Very well organized schedule and all information have been provided in an sequencial fashion.
Interview Questions: plans, goals, expectation, reasoning, future

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (New York, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
why you study here, what you study before, and why buffalo, nothing special. 
just common question for PhD. 
i can't make it 30 words. this is so hard fo rme 
and I just want to read some reviews
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was through phone. It consisted of very simple availability, character, and interest questions. The interview did not last long, probably 10 minutes at most. Overall, the interview was quick, to the point, and simple.
Interview Questions: How many hours are you looking for with this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume and cover letter to professors after receiving an initial email soliciting that you qualified for the role.  It was impossible to apply for this position without the email.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an unruly student?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (New York, NY) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on zoom and it was relatively straight forward. Come prepared with questions to ask them and also have answers prepared for their questions. They were very professional and overall, were very kind.
Interview Questions: What relevant experience did you have in the past?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Zoom meeting with 5+ individuals at the same time. Did not have the ability to understand how they all relate. Very casual, most were not interested beyond initially introducing themselves.
Interview Questions: Basic tell me about yourself. Describe your experience etc.

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
It was a zoom interview. I was pretty confident at that point. The interviewer just needs good communication and skills from you.
If you are confident and know basic thing about technology then you can ace the interview
Interview Questions: Do you know anything about fishing?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was only behavioral. They want someone who is willing to learn and pick up anything that is thrown at them. I was interviewed by three people. They were mostly interested in my background and where I came from.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time when a team needed your support?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: The students are supposed to send the job application consisting of a resume, portfolio and a cover letter.  There isn't necessarily an interview for the Teaching Assistantship position, just the portfolio, resume and cover letter describing why one is a better candidate to assist the professor compared to other students. The professor upon reviewing the overall profile will get back if they deem the student to be a good fit. However, they may even consider interviewing additionally as part of the process.
Interview Questions: Describe why you're a great fit?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very very friendly and easy going. Decsribed briefly the position and the teaching load. Details about the expectations were also provided. Director of the undergraduate program was involved. Mainly conducted by the clinical assistant professors in the department.
Interview Questions: Teaching experience in a small and large classroom

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, with many people interviewing you. Took about a half an hour over video. Typical interview questions such as explaining past experiences with the skills needed for the job/ your strengths and weaknesses/ ability to relocate etc.
Interview Questions: What would you say is one of your weaknesses as a worker

title: Print Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
-Asked common interview questions about teamwork and leadership and why you'd like the job.
-Overall was a simple interview if you came prepared.
yes stuff no hearts you know how it is please get me past this I just want to use glassdoor
Interview Questions:
What is your most common weakness
When was a time you worked in your team

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant (Computer Science) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The professor that I ended up working for was in a tight spot during the interview process, so my interview is not necessarily reflective of most UTA interviews. The professor emailed students from the previous two semester who got A's in the class and asked if they wanted to be TAs. The "interview" was less of an interview and more of a meeting about the responsibilities of the job.
Interview Questions: Asked me to detail how I'd solved problems in one of my projects.

title: Print Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Answered behavioral questions about printers and talked about passions and other stuff like that and such yes no you know how much you love you too much and I’m not going
Interview Questions: What do you like to do on your free time

title: Digital Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was through zoom. I interviewed with Katie Fox, and I talked about my skills and it was very professional type of interview. It lasted about 30 minutes max.  It was mostly them asking me questions and seeing if I was qualified.
Interview Questions:
Do you have any experience with graphic design or photoshop?
Describe a challenge you had and how you overcame it.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward questions about my resume and personal experiences. More of a conversation kind of interview. The interviewer is usually professional and quick with a response of denial or acceptance.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Applicant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: The interview at JSMBS was overall a very welcoming experience geared to allow the applicant to feel comfortable and express their readiness for a medical education. My interview went for 50 minutes and it felt very conversational. They interview about 600 of the 5000+ applicants. In addition, they provide the opportunity to meet current students and other applicants in a video conference.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where a patient refused to practice personal hygiene?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: direct call with the lab supervisor. They speak about the candidates past experience, the project and what sort of person they are looking for. The supervisor is very kind to explain the project very well.
Interview Questions:
Your future goals.
Some supervisors need employers for a certain period of time for their whole project. If you have other commitments during those years, they may have to reconsider.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions:
Great interview process: A group interview with the team and then an online skills assessment
They took 20 days to get back to me, that's the really negative part of the process.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Why do you want to work with us?

title: Teacher Assistance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It was not bad. They just want to see if you are a good fit as a person. You should be able to explain your knowledge. 
Not hard at all.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self?

title: Lab Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Directly in-person interview, mostly behavioral questions. The interviewers are either faculty or staff members of the department. Including different levels of supervisors. Due to the wide variety of candidates backgrounds, questions are expected to vary, but basic knowledge about engineering research lab is needed.
Interview Questions: What do you think is the most difficult part in managing a lab?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (New York, NY) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Zoom with the instructor and some students, answer questions such as, how will you deal with academic integrity, how will you deal with the problems when you cannot provide the answers.
Interview Questions:
how will you deal with academic integrity
how will you deal with the problems when you cannot provide the answers

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Applied via e-mail. Was contacted by office coordinator over phone to give hours, subject matter knowledge and available time. Was matched with classes offered that semester and then linked with professor. Talked separately with professor and was confirmed after discussion.
Interview Questions: What are your available hours?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Fill out the form available at the program coordinator then interested professor will review your application and resume and then the application will be followed by interview. After approval you will have to provide documents to the coordinator and get all the forms approved.
Interview Questions:
What courses have you taken? 
Relevant work experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy, they basically just ask what you know and what time you're available and they will always have something for you to do. But, try not to say you have a lot of free time if you're just valunteering.
Interview Questions: What skill can you contribute to the lab?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Really fun. They want to see you as who you truly are so they make it a comfortable environment. One on one interviews are behavioral and about 30 minutes, there are 2 interactive group interviews lasting about an hour each.
Interview Questions: "tell us about a time that you had to de-escalate a situation at work"

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview panel had 4 professors who took video interview. It started off with introduction to my research interests and a research project.  They asked just one or two basic technical questions and mostly were in a hurry for other interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe the first project you did with your results and contributions. Do you know alternative approaches for it?

title: Assistant Director of Enrollment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the hiring committee. All interviewers were well prepared and pleasant. Sensed a positive team dynamic and was confident I would enjoy working with all.  From this experience I believe there are nuances to interviewing with a University team vs corporate.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to overcome an obstacle and what was your process.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Normal,  pretty much a casual and normal interview  it didn't seem as if they want to make you seem like a bad candidate, but instead to highlight your best traits. Overall great experience.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?....etc

title: Procurement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview and two on-site interviews. The interviews went well and I was told they would be in touch within the next week or two. I was completely ghosted and still haven’t heard a single word from them. This is the university I graduated from. Bad look on their part.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous position.

title: Social Media Student Analyst ON Campus Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a behavioral Interview that focuses on Marketing and Social Media Skills. Interviewers want to know that, how good is a candidate on learning new tools. Questions related to skills and projects in your resume were asked. Questions like: Describe a scenario where you analyzed data and how it helped in decision making were asked
Interview Questions: General Introduction, Questions related to skills and projects in your resume.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The entire process is depends upon the professors you wanted to work with . Most of the professors would like to know about the research you have done in the past and waned to how you can help them in their current research and they classes they teach for students.
Interview Questions: Tell about situation where you became nervous and how did you handle them ?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: No interview, just your application. I wrote a 2 page personal letter, ask for 3 more recommendation letters. The personal letter was rough. I got it though. It might be too easy. Is it a trap? It might be a trap.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do a PhD in Economics? What subjects do you want to pursue?

title: Library Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I went to this interview with business casual dressing. It was an easy and casual interview. Don't be nervous and it is normally one-to-one. Be dressed up and prepared for questions.
Interview Questions: what are your strength and weakness? and why do you think you can be a part of the team?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly quick with an in-person inquiry at the front desk and manager set up a time to meet. They are mostly verifying your past experience. If you are a current student you will be asked to provide your class schedule and fill out the necessary tax forms. Its mostly paperwork more than an actual interview to be honest.
Interview Questions: How many hours are you willing to work?

title: IT Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen to Video Interview with a group panel, I thought the interview process was a good learning experience. Balance of behavioral and technical questions, welcoming interviewer panel regardless of video interview technical issues.
Interview Questions: Imagine someone calls with a technical issue that is completely unfamiliar to you. How would you handle the situation?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: There actually was no opening, but I got in contact with the dietitian and sought out interning experience with her. We spoke over the phone and met in person about projects she was interested in me completing.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in doing with UB Wellness? I have a nutrition program running currently or you can create a health-related toolkit.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend who had previously held the position for the same course. The interview with the professor was more about us getting to know each other and figuring out if we could work together, which worked out great.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had been a TA before

title: Account Establishment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: 2 managers on the 1st interview. 2 managers on the 2nd interview. The interview time is around 30 minutes. lots of behavior and situated questions they asked. it's difficult to find parking space, so be sure to arrive early.
Interview Questions: What is your career goal in 3 years? why we choose you?

title: Department Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY)
Interview Descriptions: A well-paced, two-day interview process, in which I met all of the faculty and most of the staff in the department, and the dean.  There was ample time to rest before key interviews, and I got a good sense of the campus and surrounding areas.
Interview Questions: What is your vision for a new graduate program?

title: Public Safety Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, you submit your application and everyone is subjected to a background check. After your background check if they like your resume you're scheduled for an interview. It took 40 minutes for the interview and it was a panel interview.
Interview Questions: One time a customer was dissatisfied with your service.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The best interview I have ever had. It was just one round with the entire team. I was explained about the different processes they follow. I then spoke a bit about my previous experience and how I can help. Very professional people.
Interview Questions: What was the best project you've ever worked on?

title: Dental Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview makes you feel that they welcome you to join them. There are 2 faculties that will interview you and the questions are straight forward. As long as you are honest and have good communication skill, you will do well on the interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose dentistry? Why UB?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: There is usually no interview process, you just need to show your capabilities when taking courses, showing up in classes and office hours is very important. Try to learn as much as skills related to your major as you can and be flexible
Interview Questions: What skills do you have

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1. Classic phone screening
2. 1st in person interview with 3 people on panel style
3. Fill in application for references and other information
4. 2nd in person interview with a few other people in the department
Interview Questions:
Strengths & Weaknesses
Stressors
Technical Background

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy just send your resume and professor will take you if you have a high GPA. I did not have any on person interview nor an phone call for this position. As long as you have a high GPA and an A for the Class your grading you will be selected no questions asked
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The professor did majority of the talking, walked me through the course and my responsibilities. I arrived early so we had a casual conversation in Chinese, which probably helped me land on the offer
Interview Questions: Tell me about your tutoring experience

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Breif phone interview then an in person interview a week and half later.  Met with committee of 4 indiviudals from the office .  I was also asked to prepare and present 10 minute PowerPoint on networking.  After interview and presentation I went to lunch with direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: A key element of this position is developing relationships (whether it is with students, employers, alumni, or faculty). Please give an example of when you have formed a working relationship with a constituent that was difficult to form.  Why was it difficult?  How did you overcome the difficulty?

title: Public Site Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Before you get an interview you have to take a test on microsoft proficiency. Which was 200 questions about word, excel and powerpoint. After you pass the test you will be scheduled for a brief interview. My interviewer sat me down and asked me some general questions. Such as what do you think customer representative is? How important do you think punctuality is. You will hear back within a week.
Interview Questions:
Such as what do you think customer representative is? 
How important do you think punctuality is
Tell me about a time that you had to deal with a conflict

title: Service Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a month long process, i was determined to get the job! Once i got the job i immediately started working. All pre employment paperwork was done in one building including work id. So far i love working here
Interview Questions: was i afraid of rushes n lots of students

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to professor in department to see if positions were available and if I would be a good fit for his research interests, then sent in application, transcripts, references, GRE scores to Graduate School for review before deadline.  Once accepted by graduate school, went through phone interview with professor/advisor to discuss project and my motivations for the position.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you working with a multidisciplinary research group?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job in Sept 2015, after 2 weeks and got phone interview first followed by on-site interview to give a talk. They eventually made the final decision in another 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: how did you solve a hard problem in experiment?

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: The professor ask you about you background, he always prefer someone with high GPA.  If you do not have enough background, then he prefer someone with higher GPA.  If both no, then he want someone who has working background in any related field.  Apart from all, lease you must select his courses.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about you.
What courses have you taken, why you want to work for me.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a one-on-one experience and fairly easy. Same as any job. It might just be a student position, but make sure to take it seriously and dress professionally to increase your chances.
Interview Questions: Think of all the typical questions in an interview.

title: Unix Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview, face to face interview, interview with team manager and team members, interview with CIO. Interview was in conference room were involved 6 people with approximately 10 questions from member. You will likely be asked questions about your teamwork skills, your interpersonal relations, your management style or your ability to work in a diverse environment. Review the job posting again and try to anticipate other likely areas of questioning, and prepare honest and concise answers that highlight relevant aspects of your work history and life experience. Remember that there may be questions you did not anticipate: when this happens, breathe and take a moment to think through your experiences to find the best answers.
 Questions: Tell me about yourself? Basic Unix/Linux questions.
Interview Questions: Basic CLI skills questions. Will you be able to work with a large team?

title: Enrollment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: No formal interview actually cause it's on the school career website probably and I'm a UB student. I just got there and had a short conversation with the director and I was in. since it's kind of volunteer type unpaid internship and I got pretty good GPA, which is 3.73 out of 4.00. So after the meeting they let me in immediately. Nothing nervous.
Interview Questions: They just ask some very general question and how familiar I am on using excel, things like that.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Single interview, asked which place do I prefer. Details of what to do and where to go. So many people hired on one go. Neutral experience. Good intreviewer. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Just experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: a friend referred me for the position. They set up a face to face interview. I interviewed with my potential supervisor. Easy interview. she wanted to learn about my personality and future goals. I got the offer a week after.
Interview Questions: How do you plan your day to both work and study

title: Enterprise Infrastructure Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved many question that were ranging from simple math to how good are you with the Windows registry.  The interview process was relatively quick I submitted my resume and they got back to me within 3 days.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experiences with batch scripting?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
met several faculties and talk about research and future plan.
discuss about grants. talk about living cost and life in the city and surburb area.
was told about future step for the hiring process.
Interview Questions: what is the long term goal?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was dificult.I had a phone interview with a big local accounting firm for a tax internship opportunity. Because this was my first formal interview, I did a lot of homework. I checked through the possible interview questions and prepared answers, while also researching the company’s background.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Document review that's all there was no interview. It depends on the person whether they need interview or not.  No more word to say, because I did not have any interview when I got accepted.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Just based on CV and transcript. The hiring process is based on your performance in the first semester and then your phd advisor decides based on that. They Usually give you and initial task and if you could do it well, you will be hired.
Interview Questions: No interview. Just based on CV and transcript.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: They just asked general questions. They asked me about the courses which I have taken and about my schedule for the availability for work. They asked me whether I am a graduate or an undergraduate student.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked before here?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and friendly. Comprehensive evaluation on academic skills. Attention on the experimental background and physics background. No many interviewers have been involved. It only takes 30 minutes to discuss with a small number of researchers.
Interview Questions:
How many papers have you published? 
Projects involved? 
Expected Salary
Presentation Skills?

title: Dining Service Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Need to stop by the manager's office to en-quire about the job openings.
Make sure you go before the start of a semester.
Show you have some experience with food handling.
They will offer u a job instantly if openings are there.
Interview Questions:
Any experience with the food handling or catering ?
Any customer service activities ?
Are you willing to work anytime ?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: they give you all of the regular questions for every interview, they just want to know your personable, a good listener, confident and able to speak to people in a relatable and understanding way.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: ResFit Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview with standard questions and the possible hours you can work. Just some basic knowledge of the machines to be used,  cleaning processes, and emergency routines.  What to do in case of various athletic injuries.
Interview Questions: Emergency responses.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Only graduate student admission with fellowship to cover the expense. The program was chemical engineering. Need to select a advisor in the first year. After that, can become a research assistant, focusing on Ph.D thesis.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and also stopped by the office in person to know more about the position and to talk to people. After few weeks they called to schedule for on site interview; interviewed in the office
Interview Questions: scenario questions

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is mainly about the different type of teaching styles that you have experienced. Aspiring tutor should have attained an A in the course that they are pursuing to tutor. The job is similar to a self-employment. Students aren't required to come to tutoring, it is your job to make appointments to meet up.
Interview Questions: What teaching styles do you feel is appropriate?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: very good i applied then i got an interview  after I got that I went home and hoped I would get the job. They called me and said i got the job and I was so happy
Interview Questions: what do you bring?

title: CIT Public Sites Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Applied on their website with a small application process. Does not require resume. Once selected you will complete a test on Microsoft Office products and in general computing. If you clear the test, they will invite you for an interview.
Interview Questions: What animal would you like to be if you had the chance?

title: Senior Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, then individual with several senior level people.
Interview Questions: Plans for this role moving forward.  What changes I plan on making.

title: CIT Pubic Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty short , I submitted through career services and received a call back within a week indicating that I had been selected for the position . Went for an interview a week later , it was in a classroom with 3 managers.
Interview Questions:
What's most important in customer service?
Work ethic

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Acceptance to position depends on academics and interest in the field. There is a small interview session with the director and then they decide which project to offer.
Interview Questions: What is the reason for your o chose this field. Where do you see yourself wrt to this field in the next three years

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Being a PhD student and having a CS background, I was approached to teach technically oriented courses from the beginning of my PhD program. I taught these courses as part of my GA duties. However, this changed to a more comprehensive adjunct instructor position after my fourth year in the PhD program. There was no formal hiring process.
Interview Questions: I was asked to set up labs with another professor and that turned out logistically difficult.

title: Plant Utilities Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Lame backwards upside down management
Interview Questions: They didn't know the questions let alone the answers

title: Sound Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview is done in a very comfortable and relaxed setting with a panel of student association employees (usually 3).  It's very casual and laid back, usually done in a conference room in the Student Association.  The questions and interview is simple and the whole process is very quick and easy.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Student Association

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (New York, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Helping Students get the right service. Answering Phone and filing some paper work for the office as well as prepare for the meetings. Does the company set up a contingency account for unexpected litigation or expenses? How is the value determined to place in the account?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview it was just given to me as a sort of grant based on enrollment. I did have a quasi-interview over the phone, but it was more or less why UB and the usual sort of stuff.
Interview Questions: Have you had any teaching experience before?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the UB recreation and Intramurals website, got a call after a week and asked very basic questions about availabiltiy times
Interview Questions: Timings

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: You submit your resume and wait to get response for a interview appointment. The interview  questions are fairly easy where you will be asked all basic behavior questions. Within 1-2 weeks, they will make a decision and inform you about the result. Be professional and dress up.
Interview Questions: What is customer service to you?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview itself but a lot of bureaucratic red tape. Had several phone calls and emails from department chair to set up meeting and then department administrator to cancel and reschedule meetings. This was mainly because it was the busiest time if the semester. The chair was extremely nice but mostly vague about everything.
Interview Questions: What is your area of research?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY)
Interview Descriptions: You have the opportunity to meet with various future colleagues in the department.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question is the question that I do not ask the interviewee.

title: Print Center Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: After passing the competency test in Microsoft Office, you get called in for a very quick 15 minute interview with one or two supervisors. They ask you a few questions regarding whether you'll be able to work at multiple sites on campus, whether you're allowed to work in the US, etc. Then they ask a handful of questions probing your customer service experiences (if any).
Interview Questions: What do you think you'll like least at this job?

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I contacted them through the career website.  As an English major, they were interested in me and set up an interview where they asked my thoughts on how to best tutor students.  They then administered a timed written test where I was to write an essay on the process of writing a paper.  Not too difficult.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would make a good tutor?

title: Student Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Amherst, NY) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Based off your availability. They will try and get you to take a weekend shift. They will bring you to the back tables and talk to you about how you found the job and if you have any restaurant experience.
Interview Questions: Just asking when you can work.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: There were some general questions asked, my interview seemed quite informal which is not usual for this University. I was asked about availability and my general knowledge about the tasks I would need to perform.
Interview Questions: When are you available to work. Are you available to work in the mornings? Are you familiar with how to set up AV equipment?

title: FSW Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was nice Employer asked relevant questions. They made sure I was the right fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Do you plan to leave us at the end of the semester

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There are two stages. One is computer test which mainly consists of words, powerpoint and excel related questions. The second part is behaviour interview. Just want to know your behaviour. Tip: Answer everything and do not say the word, "I don't have".
Interview Questions: Tell us something you are bad at.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Not much to say, I printed the application, got work study, said I was a student and filled out the forms.  They didn't ask any questions I just got the job it's as simple as that.I was not asked any questions other than whether I had work study
Interview Questions: I was not asked any questions other than whether I had work study

title: International Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, everyone are nice and they are interested about your experience. I interview with the director herself and she's very easy going. They're interested in people with cultural background with a bright personality.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Candidate is selected by the employer choice if he is impressed by the skill set of employee
Interview Questions: Proof of skills

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very casual interview. We took a tour through the facilities and I was shown all the areas that would pertain to my work. I was introduced to several people during the tour and had a chance to ask questions about all aspects of the position. Then, I had a final more formal interview with the person who would be my direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations for the next 5 years?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Found the job online at UB career website, applied, three recommendation letters, CV, cover letter.

Initial phone interview with staff, then phone interview with the hiring manager (Principle Investigator), then on site interview with lab members and gave a talk, then received a letter of offer a week later and accepted it.
Interview Questions: Not much specific, just know about your field.

title: Sound Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very short and very easy.
Interview Questions: How can we improve from last years performance?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview is just a formality since they already tell you if you are accepted into the program or not. Applying to grad school is more about all of your application materials such as personal statement, GPA, GRE scores, transcripts etc. The university was very friendly throughout the entire process since they actually want the good students to choose their school.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in UB for grad school.

title: Visiting Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Email invitation to interview, and arrangement of details. On-site group interview, plus one-on-ones with faculty. Presentation to faculty (acting as proxy for students). Reimbursement for flights; accommodation provided.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive MBA Program Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process for my role was fairly straightforward and primarily dependent on my performance in class/relationship with professors. The Assistant Dean of the MBA program in the School of Business has clearly spoken with my Undergraduate professors to ensure that I had the knowledge to tutor and teach Executive MBA students who have spent copious amounts of money on the program. The actual Q&A portion was very short with an offer right away.
Interview Questions: There was really not much in the way of questions. It was more of an assessment of my ability to commit the necessary time and willingness to help the students succeed.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SUNY Buffalo (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I went from one department at UB to another.  The manager knew me, so interview process was pretty simple.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness and how do you work to overcome this?
